meanings.definition: To cause (something) to be out of focus.
meanings.sent1: She defocussed the camera to create a blurry effect.
meanings.sent2: The photographer defocussed the lens to capture a dreamy portrait.
meanings.sent3: While trying to focus on the flower, she accidentally defocussed the entire background.
meanings.sent4: His mind was defocussing on the task at hand, lost in a daydream.
meanings.sent5: The fog outside the window defocussed the view of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: The act of making something out of focus.
meanings.sent1: The defocussing of the image gave it a soft, artistic look.
meanings.sent2: In photography, defocussing can be used to create a sense of mystery.
meanings.sent3: The defocussing of the painting made it seem like a beautiful blur of colors.
meanings.sent4: Her defocussing of reality allowed her to see the world in a different light.
meanings.sent5: The defocussing of the background made the subject stand out in the photograph.
